summary: Kris Hadlock is passionate about using code to bring life to a design, making things work and designing web applications that have a meaningful purpose.He has been a web developer and designer since 1996. Working on projects for companies such as Phoenix Children's Hospital, Phoenix Heart, Barrow Institute at Phoenix Children's Hospital, OMSI, United Airlines, JP Morgan Chase, Le Cordon Bleu and Canon, to name a few. He is the author of jQuery Mobile: Develop and Design (Peachpit), Ajax for Web Application Developers (Sams) and The ActionScript Migration Guide (New Riders) as well as a featured columnist and writer for numerous websites and design magazines, including IBM developerWorks, Peachpit.com, InformIT.com, and Practical Web Design magazine to name a few.Kris is also the owner of SUMMUS, WordHerd, WordSecured and ConvertToWP. SUMMUS is a web design and development agency specializing in fusion of form and function, learn more at summus.io. WordHerd  is a web site migration company that specializes in moving websites to WordPress, learn more at wordherd.io. WordSecured is a WordPress security company, learn more at wordsecured.com. ConvertToWP was aquired by WordHerd in 2017 and we have continued it's legacy by serving the European website migration market through this service. Specialties: Content Management System (CMS) Development, Mobile design and development, Node.js, JavaScript/AngularJS/jQuery, eCommerce, HTML5, CSS3, PHP, Flash, web design and technology author.
